IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROVIDE STUDENTS IN PRESCHOOL THROUGH GRADE 12 WITH AN ELEMENTARY AND/OR SECONDARY EDUCATION.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Wooster's mission is to maintain a school for the intellectual, spiritual, ethical, aesthetic, and physical development of boys and girls of diverse backgrounds. Since its founding it has been guided by four cardinal principles of Religion, Intellectual Excellence, Simplicity, and Hard Work. We believe that racial, social, economic, cultural, and religious diversity in the student body, staff, and Board of Trustees is central to the school's educational mission and values.
IRS990.Description: INSTRUCTION OF AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR APPROXIMATELY 364 CHILDREN ENROLLED IN PRESCHOOL THROUGH GRADE 12 BY APPROXIMATELY 80 QUALIFIED INSTRUCTORS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: FURTHERANCE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S EXEMPT PURPOSE AND DONOR STIPULATIONS.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: Noted in general publications as well as on the school's website

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.DescriptionOfNonCashAssistance: Reduction of tuition cost charged to student

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: the organization maintains a listing of all scholarship recipients and amounts awarded to each student.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: ON OCCASION THE HEADMASTER'S WIFE TRAVELS WITH HIM ON BUSINESS AS IT IS EXPECTED BY THE CONSTITUENTS AND SERVES THE SCHOOL'S INTERESTS. ON-CAMPUS HOUSING IS ALSO PROVIDED TO THE HEADMASTER AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: Two trustees are partners in the business in column a.
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: The organization paid for legal services from Cohen & Wolf P.C. a business in which two trustees are partners.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: BROKERS ARE USED TO SELL GIFTS OF SECURITIES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DIRECTORS ROBIN KAHN AND NEIL MARCUS HAVE A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: TWO EX-OFFICIO BOARD MEMBERS SERVE AS REPRESENTATIVES OF THE ALUMNI ASSOCIATION AND PARENTS' ASSOCIATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE HEADMASTER, BOARD CHAIR AND AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEW and APPROVE the form 990, and then give it TO THE FULL BOARD FOR REVIEW prior to the filing of the return.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, ALL BOARD MEMBERS AND TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIALS ARE REQUIRED TO FILL OUT A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. ALL POTENTIAL ISSUES ARE REVIEWED AND RESOLVED IMMEDIATELY BY THE HEADMASTER AND THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DETERMINATION OF COMPENSATION FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL INCLUDED CONSIDERATION OF COMPARABILITY DATA FOR INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS BOTH NATIONALLY AND REGIONALLY, WITH SPECIFIC REFERENCE TO INSTITUTIONS OF COMPARABLE SIZE, SCOPE, AND PROGRAM. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE PROPOSED THE SALARY TO THE FULL BOARD FOR APPROVAL.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: IT IS THE SCHOOL'S POLICY THAT NO DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UNLESS THE SPECIFIC REQUEST IS FIRST REVIEWED BY THE BOARD.
